title: Former Uber boss Travis Kalanick to expand food delivery kitchen business in London
text:
Travis Kalanick is bulking up his network of food delivery kitchens in London, shedding some light on a business which has been shrouded in secrecy.

The former Uber boss bought a controlling stake in British company FoodStars early last year through his venture City Storage Systems – a deal which was only revealed in filings in March.

Both CCS and FoodStars operate what are known as “dark kitchens”, where restaurants can prepare food without a high street presence to then be delivered on takeaway apps.

At the time of the tie-up, CCS had said it was “excited about its early 2018 investment” in the FoodStars portfolio, which had comprised of more than a hundred commercial kitchens in a few locations...
description: Travis Kalanick is bulking up his network of food delivery kitchens in London, shedding some light on a business which has been shrouded in secrecy.
